bug.short_desc: Live USB creator cannot be launched in a graphical way

long_desc.thetext:
In F24 updated, if I want to launch Live USB creator by Gnome Overview or Gnome Software. Nothing happened.
If I use my terminal (root session obviously) to launch LiveUSB creator: the software appeared!
In graphical case, I don't have the root's password request. With Fedora < 24, I have this popup and it works correctly. I think the problem is here. I don't have ABRT notification to show a crash of this software.

I think this might be due to Wayland switch.
I'm on Fedora 23 on Wayland and it says:
[eRadical@acasa ~]$ sudo liveusb-creator No protocol specified liveusb-creator: cannot connect to X server :0
I now switched to classical Gnome and it works!

No, my bug concerned only the graphical way to start liveusb-creator under Gnome environment. This bug happened with Xorg session too.
I can start this application via gnome-terminal (like you), but I cannot use the graphical Gnome launcher to start it... I cannot have the popup to enter my root password in this case.
liveusb-creator-3.93.1-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-ff4136b90c
